events.message: The customer reported an auto accident that occurred on May 14 involving their sedan colliding with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after initial review of the incident details and involved vehicle types.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to coordinate further communication and assist with the claim process.
The customer received official acknowledgment from the insurance company regarding the auto accident claim submission.
The company requested documents including police report, photos of the collision, and repair estimates for the damaged vehicle.
The customer submitted all requested materials, including official police report and multiple images showing vehicle damages.
Claims investigators began detailed examination of accident circumstances, verifying documents and assessing fault.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured party was not at fault for the vehicle collision.
A settlement offer was presented to the customer covering the repair costs and additional damages related to the auto accident.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal expressing satisfaction with the timely communication.
The claim was officially approved by the insurer following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the policyholder.
Payment for the approved damages was successfully transferred to the claimant’s bank account to cover vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim case was formally closed after confirmation of payment receipt and repair completion updates.
All claim files and documents were archived into the insurer’s records system for future reference and compliance purposes.
